clinical_study.brief_title: Clipless Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy Using Harmonic Scalpel Versus Conventional Method in Day Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Comparative Study Between Clipless Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy Using Harmonic Scalpel Versus Conventional Method in Day Surgery: a Prospective Randomized Study

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study was to compare between the safety and efficacy of the harmonic shears and the commonly used clip technique in achieving safe closure and division of the cystic duct in the laparoscopic cholecystectomy in day surgery setting

primary_outcome.measure: effectiveness closure of the cystic duct
primary_outcome.description: the effectiveness closure of the cystic duct is assessed on the presence or not of cystic duct bile leak

secondary_outcome.description: the presence of postoperative complication is investigated

secondary_outcome.measure: efficacy and safety of the use of harmonic scalpel performing cholecystectomy
secondary_outcome.description: the efficacy and safety of the use of harmonic scalpel performing cholecystectomy is assessed by evaluating the operative time, the presence of major or minor intraoperative complication and the postoperative complication.

arm_group.description: laparoscopic cholecystectomy performed by harmonic scalpel with closure and division of the cystic duct only by the device
laparoscopic cholecystectomy performed by harmonic scalpel with closure of the cystic duct only by titanium clip

intervention.description: The Cholecystectomy is performed using only Harmonic Scalpel to mobilize the Cholecystis and to close the cystic duct and the cystic artery
The cholecystectomy is performed using Harmonic Scalpel to mobilize the cholecystis and the cystic duct and the cystic artery are closed by titanium clips

study_pop.textblock: patients with gallstone undergoing cholecystectomy in day surgery setting

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Symptomatic Cholelithiasis
- Age under 65 yr old
- BMI under 35
- ASA I or II
Exclusion Criteria:
- Acute cholecystitis
- Suspect of common bile duct stones
